post.body:
“European Parliament failed to protect our Privacy” VERSUS “Euro-parliamentarians say a clear “no” to the anti-privacy lobby” … or #LQDN VS #EDRi … sounds like a pretty opposite point of view to me.
http://www.laquadrature.net/en/eprivacy_failed
https://edri.org/euro-parliamentarians-say-clear-no-anti-privacy-lobby/

\#vieprivée #politique #bullshit #eprivacy

Find my [weekly bookmark](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Eh65LN6swF1a8AvcjMhXQAaZikYfRjamW/?Post:2:Bookmark+22/10/2017:) on my zeroblog.
This week: \#infosec #kapersky #nsa #krack #markdown #facebook #tp-link #vim #intel

Venez participer au Forum de [La France Insoumise](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DmdupeYsm5ztFdu6p7VGrHAYDZy45YJng/) pour un avenir en commun.
\#french #politics

On the 25th of October 2017, the EU officially signed the WIFI4EU Regulation, intended to promote Internet connectivity in local communities. By ignoring the [open letter](https://www.laquadrature.net/en/print/10231) of the European open-Wifi community, this Regulation undermines the telecom ecosystem diversity. It dismisses the promotion of non-profit Internet Service Provider and enforces an authentication mechanism, forbidding what could have been free and open WiFi hotspots.

Read more on LQDN: [WIFI4EU will not be "free"](https://www.laquadrature.net/en/print/10334)

\#failed #politics #europe #bullshit #wifi4eu

comment.body: Not sure I understand "within ArchLinux chroot" properly. Would appreciate some clarification.

Oh native linux ZeroNet running on Arch which chroot on an Android host, with Tor provided by Orbot... Ok I think I've got it right this time. I though it was the ZeroNet app native on Android hence why the ArchLinux lost me.... That sounds interesting... will you "document" this?

Hi, do you guys actually see the picture? It's blank in my stream, can see 5-reshares but still blank. I did only select the picture while posting with no comments nor text it did the 'upload' animation and posting but never displayed it. bug?
blank as well on my end... hum... let's try to "delete image" and see if I can re-add it after...
ah.... i do the triple dot grey menu > delete image > and then i get the blue button now "shot image"  that is a change... but still a blank img...
but at least this time it does indicate the picture size, which wasn't the case on the previous post....

@Binchan: Hi, well, I do have the perimisison prompt on tor-browser, it was one thing i've tried as well, as I've noticed the prompt was poping each time i was checking my profile on Zerome...but still doesn't work even after granting permission. But thanks a lot for the link and clarification.

hummm hold on, this isn't exactly the same prompt!!! :) Thanks for the link, resharing it here: [How to upload img on ZeroME from tor-browser](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:56)
